content_text: A membrane-bound organelle that contains the cell's chromosomes.
Organelles that generate most of the chemical energy needed to power the cell's biochemical reactions.
A minute particle consisting of RNA and associated proteins found in large numbers in the cytoplasm of living cells.
A rigid layer of polysaccharides lying outside the plasma membrane of the cells of plants and fungi and bacteria.
The gelatinous liquid that fills the inside of a cell.
Students believe all cells are microscopic and similar in size.
explanation: Cells vary greatly in size (e.g. ostrich egg is a single cell).
common_misconception: Some cells are visible to the naked eye (like eggs) while others are microscopic.

content_text: Students think only animal cells have mitochondria because plants have chloroplasts.
explanation: Plants need mitochondria for cellular respiration too.
common_misconception: Plants have BOTH chloroplasts (for photosynthesis) AND mitochondria (for energy breakdown).
